title: 關聖帝君一百籤第四十六籤
subtitle: 孤兒報冤戈己

analysis.zh: 這首詩的主題是對權力與自由的比較與反思。首句以「君是山中萬戶侯」描繪擁有廣闊領地與地位的山中豪強；第二句「信知騎馬勝騎牛」則傳達社會普遍認為騎馬高貴、優越於騎牛。接著，作者以「今朝馬上看山色」描寫馬上行進時俯瞰山色的景象，強調在高位也能欣賞美景；最後一句「爭似騎牛得自由」則指出，雖然看似騎馬更勝，實際上像騎牛般的平實與自在，才是真正的自由。整首詩以對比手法，提醒人們不應單憑外在權勢或形式，忽略內在的自由與簡樸之美。
analysis.en: This poem's theme is a reflection on the comparison between status and freedom. The opening line, "You are a lord of a thousand households in the mountains," portrays a person of great territorial power and social standing. The second line, "It is believed that riding a horse is better than riding a cow," expresses the common belief that horse riding is superior and more prestigious. The third line, "This morning, riding the horse you see the mountain scenery," emphasizes that even from a high position one can appreciate beautiful landscapes. The final line, "It seems like riding a cow would give freedom," suggests that what appears to be superior may not bring true liberty, and that a simple, unencumbered life can offer genuine freedom. The poem, through contrast, warns that external status or form should not eclipse inner freedom and modest beauty.
analysis.jp: この詩のテーマは、権力と自由の比較と反省です。最初の行「君は山中の万戸侯」とは、広大な領地と地位を持つ山中豪族を描写しています。次の行「信知騎馬勝騎牛」では、馬を騎乗することが牛を騎乗するよりも優れているという社会的信念を示します。続く行「今朝馬上で山色を見た」では、立場が高くても美しい風景を楽しめることを強調しています。最後の行「爭似騎牛得自由」では、表面的に優れているように見えても、実際には平実で自由な暮らしこそが真の自由をもたらすことを示唆しています。対比を用いて、外見の地位や形を重視することが、内面的な自由や素朴な美しさを見逃さないように促しています。
analysis.reference: 孤兒即。晉。趙武也。史稱父朔。為屠岸賈所殺。朔妻。成公姊。遺腹生武賈。索之急。賴程嬰杵臼救之。臼以假孤兒出首。自殺。嬰乃抱趙氏真孤。匿山中十五年後。韓厥言於晉景公。立趙氏後即孤兒也。遂攻屠岸賈。滅之。以報一門之冤。

rag_analysis: According to the poem, the core meaning is a contemplation on the illusion of superiority versus the genuine value of simplicity and freedom. • The speaker is a powerful local lord, symbolized by "君是山中萬戶侯" (a lord of a thousand households in the mountains). • Horse riding is culturally viewed as more prestigious than cow riding, as reflected in "信知騎馬勝騎牛". • Yet, the poem suggests that the true freedom one feels while riding a cow ("爭似騎牛得自由") may outweigh the perceived advantage of horse riding. • The mountain scenery seen from a horse further highlights that status does not guarantee a deeper appreciation of nature. • Overall, the poem invites readers to question whether external power and appearance truly bring freedom, or if a simple, grounded life offers the genuine liberty and contentment.
